isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - ELECTRIC WIPER MOTOR (HEADER MOUNTED, AFTER JULY 1992)

svcproc.title: ELECTRIC WIPER MOTOR (HEADER MOUNTED, AFTER JULY 1992)

note.para: The electric wiper motor is not serviceable and is replaced as a unit.

svcprocinfo.para: The wiper motor is located in the front header panel next to the radio, if so equipped.

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 100 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Disconnect the battery ground cable.
Remove the radio, if so equipped, from the header. Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual and manufacturer's recommended instructions.
Remove the 6 mounting screws (Item 4) from the cab header panel (Item 7) and lower the windshield wiper/washer control panel (Item 6).

Pull the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) down to gain access to the back of the control panel. Disconnect electrical connections to the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2). Place the wiper/washer control panel out of the way.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 101 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the 6 mounting screws (Item 18) from the passenger side (right) access cover panel (Item 5) and remove it from the cab header (Item 9).
Through the header panel access openings, remove the wiper linkage shields (Items 1 and 8) by removing pan head screws (Item 3) that attach them to the wiper pivot and bracket assembly (Item 10).
Remove the clip and washer (Item 2) at the pivot point, then remove the wiper linkage (Items 13 and 15) from the wiper pivot and bracket assembly (Item 10).

Remove the 2 castellated capscrews (Item 14) from the header holding the wiper motor (Item 4) in place. Slide the motor to the passenger side (right) access opening, then rotate and roll the motor out.
Remove the clip and washer (Item 6) retaining the wiper linkage (Items 13 and 15) to the motor crank assembly (Item 17) on the wiper motor (Item 4). Pull the wiper linkage off the crank.
Disconnect the electrical connector and remove the wiper motor.
To remove the crank assembly from the wiper motor (Item 4), remove the locknut (Item 16) holding the crank assembly (Item 17) in place.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 101 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place the crank assembly (Item 17) on the wiper motor (Item 4) and install the locknut (Item 16) to the motor shaft. Tighten to 70 to 88 in-lbs. (8 to 10 Nm).

caution.para: Hold the crank on the motor while the nut is tightened or the drive gear can be stripped.

step1.para: Position the wiper motor (Item 4) at the passenger side (right) access opening, reconnect the electrical connector and install the wiper linkage right and left (Items 13 and 15) to the motor crank assembly (Item 17) with the flanges pointed to the cab front as follows:

step2.para: Install the shorter wiper linkage (Item 15) passenger side (right) first.
Install the longer wiper linkage (Item 13) driver side (left) next. Install the washer and clip (Item 6) to retain the wiper linkage on the motor crank assembly (Item 17).

step1.para: Position the wiper motor (Item 4) inside the header, rotate and slide it into place. Install the 2 castellated capscrews (Item 14) to hold it in place. Tighten to 240 to 265 in-lbs. (27 to 30 Nm).
Install the wiper linkage (Items 13 and 15) to the wiper pivot and bracket assembly (Item 10) with the washers and retaining clips (Item 2).
Install the linkage shields (Items 1 and 8) to the wiper pivot and bracket assembly (Item 10) with the pan head screws (Item 3) as follows:

step2.para: Install the shorter shield (Item 1) passenger side (right) first.
Install the longer shield (Item 8) driver side (left) next.

step1.para: Tighten pan head screws (Item 3) to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Position the passenger side (right) wiper access cover panel (Item 5) onto the cab header panel (Item 9). Install the 6 mounting screws (Item 18). Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 100 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) driver side (left) at the header panel (Item 7). Reconnect electrical connections to the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2).

Position the windshield wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) on the cab header panel (Item 7), making sure the connecting wires are not pinched. Secure it with the 6 mounting screws (Item 4). Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Install the radio in the header, if so equipped. Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual and manufacturer's instructions.
Reconnect the battery ground cable.
Check for correct wiper operation.
